result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Bail/bond hearing on May 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Justin P Deluca in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Deputy Casey Staat, of the Waukesha Sheriff's Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Pitzo.
Cross examination by attorney Miller.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
ATTORNEY MILLER REQUESTS A BAIL MOTION DATE IN FRONT OF THE TRIAL COURT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
